section.title: What the next generation Jmol will look like
section.p: Jmol has undergone a number of changes this year. Many of these changes were motivated by the goal of turning Jmol into a viable alternative for the Chime Plug-in.
In the spring the RasMol/Chime script compiler and interpreter were written. That code was introduced in release 6 of Jmol.

More recently, the graphics engine has been completely rewritten to provide true 3D rendering capabilities. It is a software implementation designed for rendering molecules and does not require any special hardware.
These pages demonstrate the pre-release development version of the Jmol applet, combining simple examples of RasMol/Chime script commands with 3D rendering.
The pages demo the capabilities of rendering atoms, bonds, biochemical concepts, dotted surfaces, and there is one page, that shows a Chime web application that has been converted to Jmol.
